text: The Three Faces of Chico is an album by drummer and bandleader Chico Hamilton, recorded in 1959 and released on the Warner Bros. label.Eric Dolphy Catalog accessed June 4, 2015 ==Reception== The AllMusic review by Matt Collar states: "This is a highly recommended set of progressive late-'50s modern jazz." ==Track listing== All compositions by Chico Hamilton except as indicated # "Miss Movement" (Eric Dolphy) - 2:16 # "She's Funny That Way" (Richard A. Whiting, Neil Moret) - 2:49 # "Trinkets" - 4:27 # "More Than You Know" (Vincent Youmans, Billy Rose, Edward Eliscu) - 5:53 # "The Best Things in Life Are Free" (Buddy DeSylva, Lew Brown, Ray Henderson) - 2:37 # "Where or When" (Richard Rodgers, Lorenz Hart) - 2:25 # "Happy Little Dance" - 2:14 # "Newport News" (Kenny Dorham) - 4:37 # "I Don't Know Why (I Just Do)" (Fred E. Ahlert, Roy Turk) - 2:56 # "No Speak No English, Man" - 0:26 ==Personnel== *Chico Hamilton - drums, vocals *Eric Dolphy - alto saxophone, bass clarinet, flute *Paul Horn - alto saxophone (tracks 2, 5, 6 & 9) *Buddy Collette - tenor saxophone (tracks 2, 5, 6 & 9) *Bill Green - baritone saxophone (tracks 2, 5, 6 & 9) *Nathan Gershman - cello *Dennis Budimir - guitar *Wyatt Ruther - bass == References == Category:1959 albums Category:Chico Hamilton albums Category:Warner Records albums
title: The Three Faces of Chico
